text:
67y/o M found down at the bottom of approximately [**7-24**] stairs. Fall was
   unwitnessed. GCS10 at scene and agitated. When paramedics arrived on
   scene he was awake and noted to be incontinent of stool and
   aggressively restless. He was transported to an OSH for management.
   Upon arrival to the OSH he was found to have a GCS of 10 and became
   increasingly combative, requiring intubation. He was intubated at OSH
   and transferred to [**Hospital1 1**] for further management and evaluation.
   Head CT: diffuse SAH, small bilateral SDH, R IPH, left
   occipital/parital subgaleal hematoma, basilar skull fx and multiple
   facial fractures including right orbital roof fx through right sinus
   and zygomatic arch fracture. Optho evaluated patient, no further
   intervention needed.
   Head CTA:  negative for aneurysm.
   CTLS FILMS: C-spine radiographically cleared however collar intact,
   awaiting final reads of TLS. +DJD
   PMH: HTN, DM
   MEDS: family is unaware of med or dosage however states he takes an
   antihypertensive and oral [**Doctor Last Name 23**] for DM
   SOCIAL: Pt came from [**Location (un) 5264**] in [**2089**]. He is followed at [**Hospital3 11644**]
   Medical Center. Family denies ETOH, drugs or smoking. He lives with his
   wife [**Name (NI) 5650**] [**Name (NI) 11248**] [**Telephone/Fax (1) 11645**] and they have no children
   Trauma, s/p unwitnessed fall
   Assessment:
   Pt admitted from ED intubated and off sedation. C-collar and logroll
   precautions maintained. Upon admission to unit pt noted for eye opening
   and moving all extremities. Neuro exam done in both English and
   Cantonese (per family pt does understand both). Throughout shift pupils
   [**3-22**] and briskly reactive, strong cough and gag, +corneals. Opens eyes
   spontaneously when off sedation >5minutes however does not track or
   follow any commands. MAE
s equally, attempts to sit up in bed and
   pulling at clothing and catheter. Hematoma noted to right eye and left
   ear bloody. Multiple small areas of ecchymosis throughout body. VSS. Pt
   febrile to 101.5. Orally intubated on CMV, lung sounds with rhonchi
   throughout and suctioned for moderate amounts of blood tinged
   secretions, OGT with dark red bloody drainage.
   Action:
   Neuro checks q1hour, sedated on Propofol gtt and intermittent Fentanyl,
   arterial line placed, Dilantin load given in ed and finished on unit
   now ordered 100mg tid, c-collar and logroll maintained until final
   reads or clinical clearance, optho cleared w/ proptosis - nl IOP
   Response:
   Pt remains with above noted exam however seems to be waking up more
   throughout night and this morning still not following commands
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor neuro status, awaiting read of TLS films, repeat
   head CT (time to be determined), meds as ordered, maintain safety with
   soft limb restraints and frequent re-orientation
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Pt noted for grimacing and hyperdynamic with nursing care. Multiple
   facial fractures and ICH. Unable to nod yes or no to pain however
   appearing uncomfortable with care
   Action:
   Fentanyl given PRN
   Response:
   Pt appearing more comfortable after administration of Fentanyl, VSS
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor for pain and medicate as needed
